name: Holiday Inn Brussels Schuman

reviews.text: The bathroom was so new and clean. on the other side of big park near by there is a small shopping district i would recommend. breakfast was good selection.
reviews.title: One if the best holiday inns

reviews.text: I had a wedding to attend in Brussels and I based myself at this hotel which is very convenient to Bus and Metro. I arrived late on a Friday night and the direct airport bus took me very close to the hotel. I had pre-booked and got a fantastic weekend rate. The room was spacious very clean and the bed was comfortable with a choice of hard or soft pillows. I had asked for a quiet room on my booking and was not disappointed. The staff were courteous and very helpful. Breakfast was worth the €22 extra per head as the buffet had a good choice and the food quality was good. All in all it was pleasant stay for two nights and I would stay there again on my next visit to Brussels.
reviews.title: Very comfortable and pleasant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked this hotel for a long weekend in Brussels and weren't disappointed.
reviews.title: Great location, friendly service

reviews.text: The hotel is within 2 minutes walk of Schuman metro station. The metro station itself is rather grim looking but once above ground, the area is fine. We had got a bargain price (Euros 135 for three nights room only for two people, as opposed to Euros 450 per night room only during the week, when the politicians and EC visitors arrive! For this price, I was expecting us to be put in a tiny, very basic room but it was a decent size, light, warm, spotlessly clean and had everything we could need in it.
reviews.title: Just what you need

reviews.text: Special mention has to go to the reception staff, who were very friendly and helpful, finding out some information we needed without even being asked to. All spoke Flemish, French and English, and I daresay other languages too. We were able to leave our suitcases on the final day for a few hours after check out to allow us to spend more time in the immediate area, exploring Jubilee and Leopold Parks. Nothing seemed any trouble to the staff.
reviews.title: Well located for airport access and EC business

reviews.text: Stayed here for two nights on a business trip. Check in at midday no problem, room and hotel in good location just off the main road.
reviews.title: Decent accommodation within a sort walk of Parliament and the Commission

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room had satellite TV, tea and coffee, decent bed with labelled "soft" and "firm" pillows, plus all the usual stuff in the bathroom and a well stocked minibar.
reviews.title: Nice hotel and price

reviews.text: Breakfast good too, with both continental and English breakfast.
reviews.title: Good if you can get a decent price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all a decent hotel.
reviews.title: Decent hotel situated at the EU offices area

reviews.text: This hotel located a little bit far from the city center but there is a near metro station to the hotel. The front office is so helpful and nice to us,, we ask for everything about brussels for the first timer come and she can tell us the most of the city. My disappointment is when we got into the room,, our room not yet been clean so she give us another room. Other than that the hotel is quite good and the room is spacious for couple. Just dont ever try the pay tv,, its a rip off..
reviews.title: Good hotel, but PLEASE do not log in on wifi with your credit card, 3rd party wifi provider will steal your number!!

reviews.text: I had to go to Brussels for a business event on short notice. All the hotels in the surrounding area, including Holiday Inn appeared to be fully booked in booking web sites. Nevertheless, I got a promotional newsletter for Exclusive Prepaid Rates in UK... but the same site was giving the option to book in Brussels in an unsurpassed rate ( 113 EUR/night ). This was one of the times that being a member of a loyalty scheme and get all these bulk promotional emails, did pay-off. Hotel was clean and reception was very efficient. I got (as per my priority club profile for preferences) a high-floor non-smoking room at the last floor (8th). They explained to me that although my Gold status has expired they would give a club room, but they were fully booked. Still I enjoyed a welcome free drink and internet access voucher. These small details make the difference in branded hotel chains. Especially next morning when I realised that I forgot my razor, the smilley receptionist literally run to their storage cabinets to give me a new one. Imagine the hassle in such a situation if I had booked in small a family-run hotel ... Queen size double bed, TFT TV, soft & firm pillows to choose. Shower only and not the usual full size bathtub. The only reason that I don't give a full 5* rating is due to the noisy fan in the bathroom. Not only it went on and on, even after lights were switched off, but it had a squicky noise. Additionally, the room next to mine was used as office facility by hotel personnel and doors were slammed early morning. Since the noisy bathroom fan affected "sleep quality" which to me is the factor of highest importance in a hotel stay, one star is deducted from top marks. Hotel is just 50 meters away from the Schuman metro station, therefore easy access to city center for dinner after a long tiresome day. All in all, hotel is highly recommended and I will stay there again if I have to be in Brussels for business or sight-seeing
reviews.title: Very good value for money and close to Schuman metro station

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: four metro stop from the Central Station is the Holiday Inn Schuman. Very nice hotel, very nice area. Very near a huge park called " Parc Cinquantinnaire". You can find a lot of restaurants of all type of cuisine, mostly authentic Belgian cuisine. Two of them actually became my favorite. The L"Esprit du Sel" and "Cafe du L"Epice Brasserie. these two great restaurants were recommended by the night shift front desk gentleman named "Lefhi". very helpful and accommodating guy. Staff are friendly, rooms are quiet, clean with all the amenities. wifi is not free though, €9 for 24 hrs.
reviews.title: A nice, quiet hotel away from the touristic area!

reviews.text: Location
reviews.title: Convenient location, value for money

reviews.text: An extremely nice location: proximity to Brussels Airport (bus stop with a ticket vending machine one block away, as well as metro station Schuman - takes less than 10 minutes to get to the city centre), many EU institutions around, several parks and museums (e.g. Autoworld), quiet at night.
reviews.title: Friendly service, nice location

reviews.text: Amenities
reviews.title: Pleasant one night stay after short break with old friends in Ardennes

reviews.text: This Holiday Inn is a convenient location sitting right in the heart of Euro Quarter in Brussels. A good direct bus that goes from the Brussels Airport to Schuman roundabout, which is about 5 mins walk to the hotel and with Jubelpark another 5 mins further down the road. Isn't a problem going to the Central/Grand Place, the metro station is just around the corner. However, it isn't that convenient, if Train is your mode of transport in/out of Brussels.
reviews.title: Fantastic location deep in the heart of Euro Quarter.

reviews.text: Really good value for money if you are just gonna be in Brussels for the weekend. Room and toilet is real clean, firm mattress and there selection (six) of pillows for you to choose. Only a couple of English tv channel though, but for EUR 50 a night I would not expect much. Staffs are generally helpful but the breakfast is abit of the pricey side. EUR 22 for a limited selection of cold and hot food isn't quite worth it.
reviews.title: Excellent home during the week

reviews.text: Would definitely stay again if I fly into Brussels.
reviews.title: reasonable budget hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stay in this hotel weekly for more than a year now, so this hotel is like a second home to me. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Breakfast is good with a wide variety of food and drinks. Internet is working fine and relatively fast. Unfortunately, the Wifi-key can only be used on one device, so you have to choose wisely on what device you want to create an internet connection (or buy multiple vouchers...).
reviews.title: BARGAIN IN BRUSSELS

reviews.text: The room I stay in is a Business room with a very nice spacious bathroom with both a bath and a walk-in shower.
reviews.title: Regiostar 2012 jury presentation

description: Stay in the heart of the EU district at the intimate Holiday Inn Brussels-Schuman hotel. With just 59 rooms our modern hotel, 12km from Brussels Airport, offers you personalised service and a friendly home-from-home. The hotel's bright blue facade stands out among Brussels' gleaming European Commission buildings, and our marble Lobby is hung with vibrant Picasso prints. Metro services speed you around the city from Metro Schuman, 500 metres from Holiday Inn Brussels-Schuman.Invite up to 8 people to an informal catch-up in Holiday Inn Brussels-Schuman's naturally lit meeting room and feel free to use the PC in the Lobby. It's a short stroll to meetings in the numerous European Parliament institutions surrounding the hotel.It's just 8 minutes from nearby Metro Schuman to Brussels city centre and sights like historic Grand-Place square. Ask our helpful staff about Brussels' Villo bike rental scheme if you'd prefer to explore the city on 2 wheels. Jubelpark's Autoworld museum, housing an impressive collection of classic cars, is a short walk from the hotel.Hot American breakfasts and light meals are served in garden-facing Pablo's Restaurant at Holiday Inn Brussels-Schuman. Cool off with complimentary soft drinks after a leisurely workout in our MiniGym, and sample local fruit beers in open-plan Pablo's Bar. Wireless Internet in your Guest room keeps you connected.
